channel.title: Delta Agiltiy

item.title: Delta Agiltiy
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Just because you’re in one place, and logically increasing the height level should bring you do another area, doesn’t mean it will (like going into dungeons. Decreasing the height level doesn’t always put you where you expect.) It’s because the client handles height levels in non-negative multiples of 4. For example, being in one place at (3200, 3200, 0) looks exactly the same as (3200, 3200, 4)

Read full topic

item.title: Delta Agiltiy
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

I do not know what base you are using, but do any of these work?

            c.savemoreinfo();
            c.savechar();
            c.disconnected = true;

If all three are used in your source, put that in the code for climbing whatever blacks you out.

EDIT: If the functions aren’t named the same in your source, find something equivalent. It shouldn’t be too hard to find

Read full topic

item.title: Delta Agiltiy
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

There are codes to reload the player’s data and/or kick the player (like in some 317 RSPS when you promote someone and they have to be kicked for their rank to update), but I recommend you don’t do that. I recommend looking at the object ID in your source to see if something funky happens when you click it. If it’s normal elsewhere to go up a heightlevel, this may be the case

Read full topic

item.title: Delta Agiltiy
item.dc:creator: @swebbyscape swebbyscape
item.description:
@swebbyscape wrote:

Okay well in my Delta RSPS i am making the barbarian Agility course my main agility course. Whenever i go up a high level, or down a high level, the screan blacks out and i have to relog for it to show up. the codes fine but i don’t understand why it does this or how to fix it.
here is one example of when it does this:

if(objectID == 2284 && absX == 2539 && absY == 3546){ sM("You climb up the net."); addSkillXP(500, 16); setAnimation(828); heightLevel = 1; toX = 2538; toY = 3546; }

Read full topic
